title: Scottish Women's Premier League 2018 season previewed at Hampden Park
description: The Scottish Women's Premier League (SWPL) had its 2018 season launch at Hampden Park on Tuesday ahead of the new campaign beginning in February.
content: Representatives from all eight of the top-flight sides were in attendance with prize money up for grabs for the winners for the first time.Defending champions Glasgow City will host Stirling University on the opening weekend, February 11, while Celtic will also meet Rangers.Scottish Cup holders Hibernian, who finished as runners-up in the league last season, host Edinburgh neighbours Spartans and club captain Joelle Murray is eyeing a domestic double.When asked whether Hibernian were targeting both the league and cup this season, Murray told Sky Sports News: "We'd like to think so."We are obviously going for the league this year but the double would be a nice complement to that."Watch the video above to hear from all eight representatives ahead of the new season...
